title: Sri Lanka rupee ends weaker on bond sales by foreigners
content: (Reuters) – The Sri Lankan rupee ended weaker on Tuesday due to dollar demand from importers and foreigners who sold rupee bonds, but dealers expect the currency to gain on an expected $1 billion inflow next week from a bond sale. The spot rupee ended at 130.80/90 per dollar, weaker from Monday’s close of 130.70/75….
